intro: Wolffia brasiliensis var. borealis, commonly known as the northern water moss, is a microscopic aquatic plant belonging to the duckweed family (Lemnaceae). It is one of the smallest flowering plants, with fronds typically measuring less than 1 millimeter in length. This species thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often forming dense mats on the surface of ponds and lakes. Its simple morphology consists of a single, broad, floating leaf with a short, rooted stalk. Wolffia brasiliensis var. borealis plays a vital role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and serving as a food source for various aquatic animals.
